content: Are you sure you want to stop filling? It will be impossible to resume filling out this form after cancellation. Filling out the form will be stopped at the stage it is currently at. The file will be marked as "Stopped".

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a warning message when a user attempts to stop filling out a form. The message informs the user that stopping filling will cancel any further progress and mark the file as "Stopped". It appears in a modal dialog.

usage.context:
displayType={ModalDialogType.modal}
 onClose={onClose}
 data-testid="stop-filling-dialog"
 >
 <ModalDialog.Header>{t("Common:StopFillingTitle")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>{t("Common:StopFillingBody")}</ModalDialog.Body>
 <ModalDialog.Footer>
 <Button
 id="stop-filling-dialog_submit"
 key="OKButton"
 label={t("Common:StopFilling")}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses full stops (.) which is not the standard way to end sentences in Arabic. It should use Arabic punctuation marks (e.g., ت).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace full stops (.) with appropriate Arabic punctuation marks (e.g., ت).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "لن يكون بالإمكان استئناف تعبئة هذا النموذج بعد الإلغاء" is a bit wordy.  A more natural translation for 'It will be impossible to resume filling out this form after cancellation' could be 'لن تتمكن من استئناف تعبئة هذا النموذج بعد الإلغاء'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace "لن يكون بالإمكان استئناف تعبئة هذا النموذج بعد الإلغاء" with "لن تتمكن من استئناف تعبئة هذا النموذج بعد الإلغاء"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "It will be impossible to resume filling out this form" is not accurately translated. 'Resume filling' implies returning to a previous state. A more appropriate translation would focus on the inability to continue.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Doldurmağı dayandırdıqdan sonra bu formanı yenidən doldurmağınız mümkün olmayacaq.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "ləğv" (cancellation) is a bit strong and might imply a complete deletion of the form process. 'Stop' might be more accurately conveyed by a term that indicates pausing or ending the current filling process.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Dayandırıldıqdan sonra bu formanı doldurmağa davam etmək mümkün olmayacaq.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "resume filling" is not accurately translated. "Възобновите попълването" while technically correct, sounds awkward in Bulgarian. A more natural phrasing would be "да продължите попълването".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Да продължите попълването

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of quotation marks for "Спряно" is not consistent with standard Bulgarian practice when referring to a status label. It's better to avoid them.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Файлът ще бъде маркиран като Спряно.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation includes quotation marks around "Zastaveno" which matches the English use of quotation marks around "Stopped". This is consistent and acceptable.

The phrase "Tämän lomakkeen täyttämistä ei voi jatkaa peruutuksen jälkeen" is slightly awkward. It translates literally to "This form's filling cannot continue after cancellation." A more natural phrasing would be "Tämän lomakkeen täyttämistä ei voi jatkaa peruutuksen jälkeen." or "Lomakkeen täyttämistä ei voi jatkaa peruutuksen jälkeen."
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lomakkeen täyttämistä ei voi jatkaa peruutuksen jälkeen.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation uses a question mark at the beginning of the sentence. It should be a statement.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Վստահ եք, որ ցանկանում եք դադարեցնել լրացումը:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English content uses quotation marks around "Stopped". The Lao translation also uses quotation marks, which is appropriate but could be improved for consistency (e.g., using Lao quotation marks).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using Lao quotation marks (“” and ‘’ ) for consistency:  ໄຟລ໌ຈະຖືກກຳນົດເປັນ “ຢຸດ”.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "in het fase waarin het zich op dat moment bevindt" is grammatically awkward. A more natural phrasing would be 'in de fase waarin het zich bevindt' or 'in de huidige fase'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: in de fase waarin het zich bevindt

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "Parado" is enclosed in double quotes, mirroring the English 'Stopped'. While not strictly incorrect, it's less natural in Portuguese and might be better without the quotes.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O ficheiro será marcado como Parado.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses a full stop (.) instead of a question mark (?) at the beginning of the first sentence. It should be a question mark as the English version uses 'Are you sure...?'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change '.' to '?' at the beginning of the first sentence: 'Tem certeza de que deseja parar de preencher?'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of "Остановлено" within quotation marks feels slightly unnatural in this context. While technically correct, it might be better to integrate it more seamlessly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Файл будет отмечен как "остановлен".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'fajl' is a transliteration from English 'file' and should be 'datoteka' for better readability and cultural appropriateness in Serbian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: datoteka

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'otkazivanje' is a somewhat formal term for 'cancellation' in this context. A more natural and user-friendly alternative would be 'prekid'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: prekid

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "It will be impossible to resume filling out this form" is too literal and awkward in Turkish. A more natural phrasing would be needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Doldurmayı tekrar başlatmak mümkün olmayacaktır.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'Filling out the form' is repeated. It can be rephrased to avoid redundancy.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Formu doldurmaya devam etmek mümkün olmayacaktır.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Filling out the form will be stopped' is somewhat clunky in Turkish. A more concise alternative exists.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Doldurma işlemi durdurulacaktır.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "resume filling" is not accurately reflected in the Chinese translation. "恢复填写进度" focuses on resuming the *progress* of filling, while the original emphasizes resuming the filling *process* itself. A more accurate translation for "resume filling" would be something along the lines of "恢复填写" or “继续填写”.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace “恢复填写进度” with “恢复填写” or “继续填写”.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of quotation marks around “已停止” might be stylistically unusual depending on the context of the application. It is best to ensure consistency with other similar messages.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Evaluate whether quotation marks around “已停止” are necessary based on the overall style of the application.
